com.apple.audio
Class CASession

java.lang.Object
  com.apple.audio.CASession
public final class CASession
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides information about the version of both the CoreAudio native run-time and the JCoreAudio release as well as managing the security protocol for using CoreAudio when a java.lang.SecurityManager is present within the runtime context of the java application or applet.

The following security policies are enforced when a security manager is present.

  • User code is not allowed to define classes in the com.apple.audio.* packages
  • Only signed user code is permitted to define subclasses of the CAObject class, when that code is loaded by a ClassLoader. If the code is not loaded by a ClassLoader (ie. the class was pre-installed) then this restriction is lifted.

public static final int buildNumber

buildStage

public static final java.lang.String buildStage
The buildType of CoreAudio given same version/subversion. Possible values are 'g' for GoldenMaster, 'f' for final candidate, 'b' for beta, 'a' for alpha

Method Detail

buildInfo

public static java.lang.String buildInfo()
This returns an info string about the current version/build of JCoreAudio

hasSecurityRestrictions

public static boolean hasSecurityRestrictions()
If there is no securityManager this method returns false. If there is a securityManager and a signedClass is registered (see CASession.registerSignedClass) this method returns false. If there is a securityManager and no signedClass this method returns true, and code running in this situation has restrictions around some of the operations that can be performed.

Returns:
true if the user code is running under a security manager that restricts the actions the user code can do.

registerSignedClass

public static boolean registerSignedClass(java.lang.Class clazz)
The application passes in a Class that has been signed, and thus gains priveleges to perform specific actions in JCoreAudio that would otherwise be prohibited. The application or applet must also register the class in the normal method to be granted priveleges by an existing java.lang.SecurityManager.

Apps that are running in a secure context should register their class before performing any other actions on Core Audio objects.

Parameters:
clazz - the singed Class that is registered. If null, this will remove previously granted security priveleges.
Returns:
true if the class is signed and thus registered. Returns false if the class is null, or is not signed.
